Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Member, Steering Committee, Italian Political Science Review
Member, Editorial Committee, Quaderni dell’Osservatorio Elettorale

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: ORGANIZZAZIONE DI CONVEGNI E PANEL • 2016 Local organizer, IMEBESS - International Meeting on Experimental and Behavioral Social Sciences, Rome. • 2016 Organizer, Workshop “Turbulent Times: Economic Change and Political Instability in Western Democracies”, CISE (Italian Centre for Electoral Studies), Rome, Italy. http://bit.ly/2ch1Db8 • 2014 Co-chair, Section “Changing patterns of voting behaviour and party competition”, ECPR General Conference, Glasgow, Scotland. • 2014 Co-chair, Section “Elezioni e Comportamento di voto” [Elections and Voting Behaviour], SISP (Italian Society of Political Science) General Conference, Perugia, Italy. • 2013 Co-chair, Section “Elezioni e Comportamento di voto” [Elections and Voting Behaviour], SISP (Italian Society of Political Science) General Conference, Florence, Italy. • 2012 Local organizer, Winter School on “Methodological Issues in Comparative Electoral Analysis” (scientific coordinator: Cees van der Eijk), COST Action IS0806 “The True European Voter”, Rome, Italy. • 2011 Organizer, Conference “Revisiting Party Identification: American and European Perspectives”, CISE (Italian Centre for Electoral Studies), Rome, Italy. http://bit.ly/rpid2011 • 2010 Co-chair, Panel “I rapporti cambiano, i valori restano? Una ricerca quantitativa e qualitativa sulla cultura politica in Toscana” [Relationships change, values stay? A quantitative and qualitative research on political culture in Tuscany], SISP (Italian Society of Political Science) General Conference, Venice, Italy. • 2008 Co-chair, Panel “Le elezioni 2008” [The 2008 Elections], SISP (Italian Society of Political Science) General Conference, Pavia, Italy.

PRESENTAZIONI A CONFERENZE INTERNAZIONALI "PEER-REVIEWED" (fino al 2012): • 2012 (with E. Sapir and C. Arnold). Learning from second‐order elections? The dynamics of issue salience during national and European elections. Paper presented at the 2012 Elections, Public Opinion and Parties (EPOP) conference, University of Oxford, Oxford (UK), 7-9 September. • 2012 (with Mark N. Franklin). Party matters: how the mainsprings of party support differ due to heterogeneity in party characteristics. Paper presented at the Midwest Political Science Association Annual Meeting, Chicago, April. • 2011 (with Cristiano Vezzoni). How far away is the capital city? Geographical remoteness as an element of the centre-periphery cleavage, and its impact on individual vote choice, paper presented at the ECPR General Conference, Reykjavik, August. • 2011 (with Mark N. Franklin). Disentangling components of PTV measures, with an application to the EES 2009. Paper presented at the 1st European Conference on Comparative Electoral Research, Sofia, Bulgaria, December. • 2011 (with Mark N. Franklin). Generic variable analysis: climbing the ladder of generality with social science data. Paper presented at the 1st European Conference on Comparative Electoral Research, Sofia, Bulgaria, December. • 2011 (with Till Weber). Issue yield: An integrated model of party competition, with an empirical analysis, paper presented at the 69th Midwest Political Science Association National Conference, Chicago, 30 march-3 april 2011. • 2011 (with Till Weber). Issue yield: An integrated model of party competition, with an empirical analysis. Paper presented at the workshop on “Issue congruence and policy responsiveness in European governance”, ECPR Joint Sessions of Workshops, St. Gallen, Switzerland, April. • 2010. Political issues and party competition. A unified framework for analysis. Paper presented at the workshop on "Electoral Change in the 21st Century: Dealignment or Realignment?", ECPR Joint Sessions of Workshops, Münster, Germany, April. • 2006. A Matter of Attraction. Voting Behaviour of Heterogeneous Voters. Paper presented at the workshop on "Beyond 'Party Identification and Beyond'", ECPR Joint Sessions of Workshops, Nicosia, Cyprus, May.

PRESENTAZIONI A CONFERENZE INTERNAZIONALI "PEER-REVIEWED" (2012-2016): • 2016 (with Diego Garzia, Alexander H. Trechsel and Andrea De Angelis). Geographical variations of issue attitudes?Evidence from a geo-localized Voting Advice Application, presentation at the ECPR General Conference 2016, Prague, 4-6 September. • 2016 (with Till Weber). Party Agendas, Issue Yield and Political Inequality, paper presented at the Midwest Political Science Association Annual Meeting, Chicago, April. • 2016 (with Vincenzo Emanuele and Andrea De Angelis). Issue Yield and Strategic Party Communication on Twitter: A Case Study, paper presented at the Midwest Political Science Association Annual Meeting, Chicago, April. • 2015 (with Till Weber). Party Agendas, Issue Yield and Political Inequality, paper presented at the APSA (American Political Science Association) Annual Meeting, San Francisco, 3 Sep. • 2015 (with D. Garzia and A. Trechsel), Placing Parties and Voters in Supranational Elections: An Introduction to euandi, paper presented at the APSA (American Political Science Association) Annual Meeting, San Francisco, 5 Sep. • 2015 (with A. Trechsel and D. Garzia). Ist die Zeit reif? 2014 as the first (truly) European elections, paper presented at the APSA (American Political Science Association) Annual Meeting, San Francisco, 3 Sep. • 2015 (with Aldo Paparo and David Brady). Propensities to vote: Investigating the properties of a new measurement for partisanship in the US, European Political Science Association (EPSA) Annual Conference, Vienna, 26 June 2015 • 2015 (with Aldo Paparo and David Brady). Propensities to vote: Investigating the properties of a new measurement for partisanship. Paper presented at the Midwest Political Science Association Annual Meeting, Chicago, April. • 2015 (with Mark N. Franklin and Till Weber). The risks and opportunities of Europe: Issue Yield in elections to the European Parliament. Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Various professional research activities: questionnaire development and survey data analysis; analysis of aggregate electoral data, etc., for various institutional and private subjects at the local and regional level.

Principal Investigator: “Cultura politica, democrazia e partecipazione in Toscana”, funded by Regione Toscana. CATI interviews, plus qualitative in-depth interviews. Centro Italiano Studi Elettorali (CISE), Università di Firenze.

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: 2012 Best Under 40 Political Science Book Award for 2010-2011, SISP (Italian Society of Political Science) 2006 Young Researchers Award, Polis¸ Istituto Cattaneo 2005 Celso Ghini Award for the best M.A. thesis on electoral topics, SISE (Italian Electoral Studies Society)

Deputy Coordinator, Ph.D. Programme in Political Theory and Political Science, LUISS "Guido Carli", Rome.
1st year Seminar "Citizens, Elections, Parties: The Circuit of Representation", Ph.D. Programme in Political Theory and Political Science, LUISS "Guido Carli", Rome.
